alert.note: Alert for Wheeler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 09 at 1:46AM CDT until July 09 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM CDT FOR WHEELER...GRAY...SOUTHEASTERN ROBERTS AND HEMPHILL COUNTIES... At 146 AM CDT, automated weather equipment reported severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Durham to 3 miles southeast of New Mobeetie to 8 miles west of Lefors, moving southeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Automated weather equipment. At 131 AM CDT, a 69 mph wind gust was recorded 10 miles east of Miami. IMPACT...Expect some tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Pampa, Shamrock, Miami, Briscoe, Wheeler, Mclean, Lefors, New Mobeetie, Lake Mcclellan, Twitty, Allison, Lela, Lake Marvin, Kellerville, Lora, Alanreed, Codman and Mobeetie. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
